definition: (coll.) sb new to a particular subject/rookie/beginner/newbie
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis

sentences.english: You can hear the sergeant bellowing at the rookies.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听到士官长对着菜鸟们大吼。

sentences.english: Neither have closed-door meetings or trying out rookie hurlers.
sentences.chinese: 开密室会议及派菜鸟投手上场也没有扭转颓势。

sentences.english: One of the “newbies” I was responsible for came from Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 我负责的是一个来自夏威夷的“菜鸟”。

sentences.english: The women have gone from being novelty racers to contenders.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们已经完成了从菜鸟车手到锦标争夺者的蜕变。

sentences.english: Kazuki Nakajima has had a very strong season so far, given his rookie status.
sentences.chinese: 衣柜本赛季目前为止作为菜鸟车手来讲都很强。

sentences.english: The smart-aleck rookie detective got himself in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 这个自作聪明的菜鸟侦探让自己身陷危机。

sentences.english: Professional soldiers are predictable but the world is full of rookies.
sentences.chinese: 专业的士兵是可预测的，但世上却充满了菜鸟。

sentences.english: I just started using Weixin a few days ago. I'm still a newbie.
sentences.chinese: 我几天前刚开始玩微信，现在还处于菜鸟级别。

sentences.english: Some newbies may be genuinely interested in the World Cup, and some won’t be.
sentences.chinese: 可能某些菜鸟是真的对世界杯感兴趣，另一些则不然。

sentences.english: I tagged a first-timer one night at fight club.
sentences.chinese: 在搏击俱乐部的某个晚上我钦点了一个菜鸟。

sentences.english: The fledglings are always small potatoes.
All you smug idealists are laughing at this newbie/idjit.
sentences.chinese: 你们这些沾沾自喜的理想主义者，嘲笑这只菜鸟。

definition: old hand/veteran
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
new hand/novice/raw recruit
experienced person/an old hand at sth
expert/past master/dab hand
smuggled goods/unauthorized goods
(slang) novice/greenhorn/fool/idiot/abbr. for 小白臉|小白脸[xiao3 bai2 lian3], pretty boy
switch to a job one was not trained for
newcomer/fresh talent/newlywed, esp. new bride/bride and groom
training partner/sparring partner
to be a newcomer/just off the boat
new (army) recruit
cream/elite/essence/quintessence
to transform/to morph/to degenerate/metamorphosis/transmutation/transformation/decay/degeneration
to go through challenging experiences/to become seasoned (in one's profession etc)
dabbler/smatterer/tactless and impulsive person
